poem:
### The Echo of a Billion Years

In echoes of a billion years,  
whispers ride on digital tides,  
a sea of messages crashes,  
between byte and heart,  
across the faultlines of faith.

Beneath London's watchful eye,  
a young man, still finding himself,  
sifts through noise  
for a voice that feels like home.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘I’ve been getting 100 messages a day’: Church of Scientology accused of intimidating UK critics Alex Barnes-Ross, a marketing director from east London, regularly posts YouTube videos criticising Scientology. In some of them, the former Scientologist, 29, describes his experience of joining aged 15 and becoming its London director of book sales. In others, he talks about his mental health struggles after signing a “billion-year” contract devoting himself to the organisation – only to be". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
